snippet: The agreement, which includes a new missile defense system in Japan and coordination on cyberthreats, signals the United States’ increased focus on Asia.
abstract: United States and Japan agree to broaden their security alliance, expanding Japan’s role while trying to show American determination to remain a dominant presence in the region; agreement, which will position surveillance drones in Japan for the first time, underscores the two countries’ efforts to respond to growing challenges from China and North Korea.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and MARTIN FACKLER
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, and Jane Perlez from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The agreement, which includes a new missile defense system in Japan and coordination on cyberthreats, signals the United States’ increased focus on Asia.
